solution_line_template: Five pounds of strawberries cost ${strawberry_cost_per_pound} x {strawberry_pounds} = $<<{strawberry_cost_per_pound}*{strawberry_pounds}={total_strawberry_cost}>>{total_strawberry_cost}.
A pound of cherries costs ${strawberry_cost_per_pound} x {cherry_cost_multiplier} = $<<{strawberry_cost_per_pound}*{cherry_cost_multiplier}={cherry_cost_per_pound}>>{cherry_cost_per_pound}.
Five pounds of cherries cost ${cherry_cost_per_pound} x {cherry_pounds} = $<<{cherry_cost_per_pound}*{cherry_pounds}={total_cherry_cost}>>{total_cherry_cost}.
Therefore, it will cost Briget a total of ${total_strawberry_cost} + ${total_cherry_cost} = $<<{total_strawberry_cost}+{total_cherry_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
